Impact is an archaeological card game for two or more players. The main goal of each player is to use game cards inspired by the world of archaeological science and collect so called scientific points.

The first player who reaches the required amount of scientific points wins the game. Obtaining those points depends on the abilities of individual cards (and their combinations), that are used for construction of gaming decks. These cards are divided into five main card types. A player can play artecafts, archaeological sites, scientists, event cards and cards of so called written sources. Cards are also divided in unique and non-unique categories (unique means that you can play a card just once, non-unique cards can be played multiple times) and temporary (especially event cards) and permanent cards. Every player owns his or her own constructed deck, whose construction and the ability to defeat an opponent depends clearly on his or her combinational skill and his or her own inventiveness.
During the game players draw cards from their decks and play them from their hands. They can play cards to support their gaming strategy or to disturb the opponent's game.

The game primarily serves as an instrument of popularization and education in archaeology.
156609.name: Impact

156610.name: Mord auf Hoher See
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
156610.description:
User summary

A short Midgard scenario by Jürgen Franke issued for 2014's Gratisrollenspieltag. The adventure is designed to be run when characters embark on a sea voyage, and targets gamemasters who wish to make such journeys more interesting than, "After two weeks, you arrive ..."

The scenario details a voyage aboard the Red Manatee, and includes a goodly assortment of NPCs for the players to ineract with.

156613.name: Zettel-RPG
156613.description:
User summary

All the rules needed to play the Zettel-RPG, a small universal game system designed to be played with minimal preparation. The rules take a few minutes to read, character generation even less. Simple and portable.

Jens Stengel's photographs of everything from dice to walnut shells provide a refreshingly unorthodox backdrop.

Premiered at Gratisrollenspieltag 2014.

156614.name: The Kroten Campaign Guide
156614.description:
from the Introductory Notes:
This manual describes the Town of Kroten and the nearby area, which is located on Lendore Isle in the World of Greyhawk. Details include nomenclature used by the author, world background, and local features. Also included is a detailed description of the Town of Kroten, excepting three key areas: The Fane of Syrul, the Fane of Pyremius, and the Castle Kroten itself. These areas are described in L5B: The Kroten Adventures.

156615.description:
Put your strategy and skill to the test in Fishing Party to become the first player to catch all six kinds of fish in the lake.

Game consists of 52 fish cards and 58 special cards and one die.

To start your fishing party, place six cards face up as the fishing supply store, and deal six cards to each player.

A player may take one of four actions:

1. Discard up to three cards and draw from the face down deck
2. Exchange up to three cards with the face up supply store
3. Play a special card
4. Play a fish card and try to catch it

As well, as a free action, a player may swap or play a new lure.

To catch a fish you must roll the die and match the die range for that fish type and the lure you are using. Some lures work better for each type of fish. Special cards can be used to steal fish from other players, break their rods or help you catch the biggest fish. Be careful not to draw the hook card or you may need the first aid kit.

The game ends when one player has caught one of each type of fish. To win, you must try to collect the most fish (2 points), the biggest single fish (2 points) and the total weight of your fish (1 point per pound).
156615.name: Fishing Party

156616.name: Castleminer Z
156616.description:
In CastleMiner Z, players have to mine for their own resources instead of starting with them. Players can also craft weapons such as a shotgun or assault rifle. Another change from the original game is the addition of enemies including zombies, dragons, and demons. Online modes accommodate 2 to 8 player cooperative gameplay.

CastleMiner Z introduces "Awards", which are awarded for doing different things such as playing online for a certain number of hours, traveling at least a certain distance, crafting various items, and killing several zombies.

Source: Wikipedia, "CastleMiner", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

156617.name: Paladin Poker
156617.description:
Nine Paladins have gathered for a fighting tournament and
your entertainment. The Emperor wishes to use this
tournament to find his next Great War General: you! As a War
General candidate, you must consistently bet on the Victor
Paladin of each fight to prove your strategic ability.

The Emperor has given each War General candidate one
crossed-out picture of a Paladin that will NOT be victorious.
Use your deduction and reasoning skills to find out which
Paladin will be the Victor Paladin by closely following your
opponent’s moves. At the end of each fight, Victory Points are
awarded to bettors who have placed bets on the Victor
Paladin.

156618.name: Power-Up
156618.description:
Power-Up is the modern-retro styled Shoot-Em-Up from one-man game studio, Psychotic Psoftware.

Spanning vibrant locations to a monster soundtrack, Power-Up thrusts you into battle with a diverse range of fighters, freighters and titanic level guardians. If you loved retro SHMUP classics like R-Type, Hellfire or Project-X, you'll get a real kick out of Power-Up's slick, detailed visuals, challenging gameplay and impressive arsenal of weapons

Source: The Developer Website.

156619.name: Dragon's Keep
156619.description:
User Summary

A High-Res learning adventure. Rescue 16 different animals from the dragon.

Originally came with a map and stickers to help track your progress. Designed for children seven and up.

156620.name: Fighting Fantazine (Issue 7 - Sep 2011)
rpgissuearticle: Aelous Raven and the Wrath of the Sea-Witch
Chronicle of Heroes: A Darkness over Kaad
Everything I Really Need to Know I Learnt from Reading Fighting Fantasy Gamebooks, Part 5
The Fact of Fiction: Seas of Blood
156620.description:
Featured in this issue:

Interviews with Graeme Davis and Paul Struth.
Mini adventure by Paul Struth.
Short fiction by Andrew Chapman.

And all the regular articles...

156621.name: The Kroten Adventures
156621.description:
from the Introductory Notes:
This manual details five adventures set in and around Kroten:

The Crypt Adventure
The Fane of Syrul
The Fane of Pyremius
Castle Kroten
Hell




Note that the Hell adventure is a follow-on to the Castle Kroten adventure, and takes place in the Nine Hells, as the name indicates.

The maps for the adventures in this manual are contained in the L5 Kroten Map Pack.

Some items in this manuscript, including new magic items, new spells, and new cleric abilities, are described in L5C, The Kroten Campaign Companion.

156622.name: Skyborn
156622.description:
Life under the rule of the winged Skyborn race isn't so bad for Claret Spencer, the star mechanic of an independent repair shop. She can patch up just about anything...but when a certain cravat-wearing customer turns her life upside-down, she finds herself pulled into an epic, city-wide conflict that's going to take a lot more than elbow grease to fix!

Features: Lovable, addicting characters
Unique Steampunk setting
Classic look, modern feel
Stunning Original soundtrack

Source: The Developer Website.

156623.name: The Kroten Campaign Companion
156623.description:
from the Introduction:

This manual provides a wide variety of optional new material for the game. The new items include:


Rules specific to artisans, magic items, alignment,


thief, and races.

Gambling games.
New weapons and armor.
New gods and cleric abilities.
New spells.
new magic items.
new monsters.

156624.name: The Kroten Maps
156624.description:
from the Introduction:

This map pack contains all the maps referenced in the following manuals:
L5A: The Kroten Campaign Guide
L5B: The Kroten Adventures

156625.name: Fighting Fantazine (Issue 8 - Feb 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Aelous Raven and the Wrath of the Sea-Witch
Chronicle of Heroes: The Warlock of Firetop Mountain
Everything I Really Need to Know I Learnt from Reading Fighting Fantasy Spin-off Gamebooks
The Book in which You Are the Hero
156625.description:
Featured in this issue:

Interviews with Ross Brierly, Jamie Fry, and Chris Sterling.
Mini adventure by Alexander Ballingall.
Comic by Aida Rintarou.

And all the regular articles...

156626.name: Whitewash
156626.description:
User Summary

This stealth game follows Bill, who wakes up in a testing lab, told by voices to play a game that becomes more and more difficult and deadly with every solution.

156627.name: Fighting Fantazine (Issue 9 - Jul 2012)
rpgissuearticle: The Fact of Fiction: Deathtrap Dungeon
The Hunt for the Black Whale
The Rise and Fall and Rise of Gamebooks in Germany
156627.description:
Featured in this issue:

Interview with Ian Miller.
Mini adventure by Ed Jolley.

And the all the regular articles...

156628.name: Arson & Plunder
156628.description:
Arson and Plunder is a 2D arcade/beat'em up adventure based on the big genre classics of the 90's. The core gameplay has been technically modernized and is now demanding your vote!

In perfect beat'em up style you wade as a merciless orc or magic wielding elf through the blood of hordes of your enemies.

In single player mode, switch between characters who have magically been bound to each other.

The game features beautiful 2D visuals, interactive scenarios and a humorous story. Survive and free your realm from the human occupying power in five difficulty levels. While playing you can always switch between being an orc or an elf. This element makes the game especially dynamic. The controls are always intuitive and help you to carve your way through an adventure bursting with humor and action.

Source: The Game Website.

156629.name: Festival of the Bizarre
156629.description:
from Welcome to the Thaecian Isles:
It is the author’s intent that this book is not just as sourcebook, nor is it a straightforward adventure module. It was designed to be the start (or part of) an ongoing campaign where the GM and the players can explore the Thaecian
Isles together. So instead of the regular adventure or a dry sourcebook, the islands are presented as an open-ended realm where the characters can explore freely, encountering adventure and danger at every turn.

Designed for a mid-to high level party.

It begins with the player characters receiving a mission to find a Gnorl’s missing Secret. She will pay the for the characters to reach Thaecia Isle just in time for the famous Festival of the Bizarre. While the hunt for the Secret is the impetus for the characters to travel to the islands, they are in no way constrained to follow the one plotline and are free to explore any part of the islands they desire. While terrible dangers lurks at every turn, there is also the opportunity for great rewards, including the chance to uncover rare magics and treasures not seen since the Great Disaster.

156630.name: Fighting Fantazine (Issue 10 - Dec 2012)
rpgissuearticle: 30 Reasons Why We Love Fighting Fantasy
Aelous Raven and the Wrath of the Sea-Witch
Everything I Really Need to Know I Learnt from Reading Fighting Fantasy Gamebooks, Part 6
Ian Livingstone Presents Thirty Years of Fighting Fantasy
Sometimes, Two Dice, a Pencil and an Eraser Are NOT All You Need
The History and Development of Gamebooks
156630.description:
Featured in this issue:

Interview with Paul Mason.
Mini adventure by Kieran Coghlan.
Special article on 30 years of FF.

And all the regular articles...

156631.name: 99 Waves to Die
156631.description:
99 Waves to Die is a twin stick arcade shooter, inspired by the arcade games, and 8-bit home consoles/computers, of the 1980′s.

Remember when video games used to be insanely difficult?

When you used to spend £’s in the local arcade trying to get the high score?

When having your three letter initials/acronym at the top of the table meant you were the king?

Well we do, and that is why we are creating 99 Waves to Die.

A ship, 3 lives, limited smart-bombs and scarce power-ups is all you have to try and survive the waves of enemies that rally against you.

With voxel based graphics, inspired by 80′s video game classics, a pumping chiptune soundtrack & excellent 8-bit audio fx, 99 Waves to Die will take you back to those seedy, dark, smoke filled arcades of your childhood. Re-live the 80′s heyday of the arcade, but without the 10p’s.

Can you survive to see Wave 99?

Source: The Developer Website.

156632.name: Fighting Fantazine (Issue 11 - Apr 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Aelous Raven and the Wrath of the Sea-Witch
Chronicle of Heroes: The Frozen North
Everything I Need to Know I Learnt from Playing Fighting Fantasy RPG Adventures
The Fact of Fiction: Star Strider
156632.description:
Featured in this issue:

Interview with Paul Mason.
Mini adventure by Stuart Lloyd.

And all the regular articles (and a few new ones)...

156633.name: Alchemy Mysteries: Prague Legends
156633.description:
Your journey as Eva will take you throughout Prague, as you’ll explore an antique shop full of mysterious books and artifacts, an ancient cemetery with creepy crypts, an alchemy lab and modern café, among other locations. The story will become more complex as you go, as Eva finds that she has ties to the Holy Roman Emperor and a band of black magicians that are working to creating a golem to destroy the entire world.

Source: The Developer Website.

156634.name: Fighting Fantazine (Issue 12 - Oct 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Chronicle of Heroes: The Spell of Death!
Librogame: The Chimeric Italian Passion for Gamebooks
The Fact of Fiction: Vault of the Vampire
The Geography of Khare, Cityport of Traps
156634.description:
Featured in this issue:

Interviews with Robin Waterfield and Nathan Penlington.
Mini adventure by Ian Brocklehurst.
History of gamebooks in Italy.
Investigation on the geography of Khare.

And all the regular articles...

156636.description:
What do you get when you mix Chaos, Cribbage, and Carnage?

War Elephant Racing (W.E.R.) is a fast paced game of chance and skill. War elephants will be bumping and crashing into each other on a tight course sending the others into a spin that will cost them crucial game points. Players must carefully balance a number of objectives, be quick with reactions, and recognize all of the scoring combinations to be able to beat their opponent. It is a game where experience counts for a great deal although a little bit of luck always helps. New and young players will be able to jump in fairly quickly and give the vets a run for their money.

War Elephant Racing uses Xhaos cards to spice up the race and increase the competitive action. Xhaos cards are special cards that call upon a special ability of an elephant of renown to give the players huge advantages to use against their competition. Special timing will provide the players with an edge over the other war elephant racers.

War Elephant Racing is played closely to Cribbage, each player is dealt war elephant racing cards and then must take turns laying one card at a time from their hand to attempt to get pairs, runs, and target numbers to score points. Each point allows the player to move their elephant an equal amount of points. Once each player has played all of the cards from their hand they then take turns adding up the different combinations of "points" in their hand to move their elephants. Players move around the tight track for six laps.

While players are moving their elephants if they land in a space that has another elephant they "bump" them. When a bump occurs the bump dice are rolled allowing the elephant to pass through, or send the bumped elephant in a spin, or send themselves in a spin costing valuable points.

War Elephant Racing also has "Xhaos" cards which allow them to make ranged attacks, powerful bumps, throw spectators in the path, and more. The xhaos cards are a great fun edge that each player will have to help them win the race. Almost all of the xhaos cards are named after famous elephants in history, and their effect in the game is related to their fame.
156636.name: War Elephant Racing

156637.description:
Fall Schematic: The Cooperative Card Game is set in a world in which virtual identities pilot unique mechanized constructs called "frames" across a physical world.

Some of the more legendary frames of the world are equipped with powerful relics that they use to energize and deploy dormant lesser constructs called "rigs" to battlefields. In this time of conflict, frames command rigs directly from the field of battle in an ever-growing struggle with the ominous threat commonly referred to as "the Glitch".

Fall Schematic: The Cooperative Card Game can be played with one to four players. A Starter Kit contains enough contents for a player to enjoy a quick single-player encounter. Combining multiple Starter Kits allows a group of players to engage in a longer, more challenging experience. Over the course of the game players will play rigs, attach mods, and resolve actions and abilities. The Glitch runs on an automated mechanism and does not require any player to control the Glitch's deck.
156637.name: Fall Schematic: The Cooperative Card Game

156638.name: Rise of the Drow
156638.description:
Publisher Blurb

Full color

Foreword by Ed Greenwood

If absolute power corrupts absolutely, Matron Maelora best beware; her plans for total domination of the Underworld are close to satisfactory completion, while attacks on the Upperworld have become increasingly successful. The other power-hungry drow families of Holoth may despise her but they know a true leader when they see one, and House Gullion has been revealed as the path to glory. With the entire Underworld in chaos and the Spider Goddess regularly communing with her chosen Matron, far greater dreams than mere regional conquest are within the grasp of the drow as Maelora prepares a grand dark elf army for victory! With mystical allies in place, other Underworld races beneath her heel or cowering behind fortified walls, and every drow ready to play their part when she gives the word, it is time for the PCs to make their move against the evil Matron Maelora and her increasing dominance, but how will they go about it? Can they ensure their own success when an entire city is standing against them? It is time for them to halt the Rise of the Drow!

The Rise of the Drow Trilogy (revised) contains:

Brand new illustrations by Mates Laurentiu, Rick Hershey, Jacob Blackmon, Jen Page, and Satine Phoenix
New and revised maps by 3x ENnie award winning cartographer Todd Gamble
The dwarven trade city of Embla fleshed out in even greater detail
A fully expanded Fungi Forest spanning over 80 pages with new spells and items
Three main paths for the PCs to explore with options to take your adventures even farther
The dwarven capital of Stoneholme by Kevin Mickelson author of Mask of Death adventure module
Jorumgard the Deep Dragon Lair by Owen KC Stephens of Super Genius Games
Lepakkuros, a new race by Stephen Yeardley
The story of the ‘blighted dwarves’ and a new Blighted Template for crafting your own corrupted creatures by Jason Stoffa of Fat Goblin Games
The foul drow House Invidious by Brian Berg of TPK Games
Holoth, the mighty drow city of the Underworld completely revised and expanded by Christina Stiles of Kobold Press & Super Genius Games.
The gargantuan ‘Temple of the Spider Goddess’ by Joshua Gullion of AaW
House Gullion’s home, ‘Tolgorith Tower’ which spans across 6 maps and includes over 30 different locations for your PCs to explore
Supplemental histories on each member of House Gullion
The demi-plane of Venom
Multiple ways for the PCs to end the adventure and many more ways to continue with new adventures in the Underworld!
New artifacts like the powerful soul-stealing Vidrefacte or the plane-travelling, multi-environment using, spell-casting, mobile weapon that is the Vessel of Naraneus
New Traps like Ochre Jelly Dust
New Special Abilies such as the Third Eye of Fear
New Feats including Fused Weapon Fighting
New Items like Giant Green-spored Parasol Mushroom Poison and Fungi Forest Kombucha
New Magical Items such as the Coin of Singing and Mushroom Armor
New Mushroom and Drow domains
Loads of new spells perfect for the Underworld
New Monsters, too numerous to list!
New Classes
New Artifacts
and so much more!

156639.name: Diskworld Diceless RPG
156639.description:
from Introduction: 1996:
Remembering the ease of play and storyteller feel of the Amber Diceless RPG I decided to write up a new Diskworld RPG, combining the wonderful descriptions in the GURPS book, with the ease of play offered by the Amber rules.

These pages are meant to be an alternative Rules system to the GURPS: Diskworld book, and are not meant to stand alone. So go out and buy GURPS: Diskworld (well worth it for any Pratchett fan) and enjoy the read. Then download these rules for a truly Anhkmorporkian roleplaying experience.

156640.name: Yellow Jack
156640.description:
Autumn, 1739. Fierce economic competition between Britain and Spain has broken into open war: the War of Jenkin’s Ear.

As His Britannic Majesty’s naval commander-in-chief in the Caribbean, your duties have suddenly multiplied. Their Lordships at the Admiralty demand action. Parliament expects the speedy conquest of Spain’s New World possessions – ALL of them – but is unwilling to supply men and ships. That would require the adoption of methods suitable only under a ‘French Despotism’. Before you utter them let it be known that your objections are unpatriotic and un-British. Meanwhile, the powerful Planters’ Lobby is insisting you make defending their islands your top priority, while the equally powerful Traders‘ Lobby is demanding convoy protection and simultaneously accusing you of ‘pressing’ merchant seamen into service aboard your ships.
Or, can you honourably serve the great House of Bourbon, whose scions rule France and Spain? The English heretics have unjustly fabricated a war. They are jealous of Spain’s greatness and desire her colonies for their own. For years they have paid lip service to the international laws of commerce while breaking those same laws at every opportunity. Of late, His Most Catholic Majesty had graciously agreed to accept arbitration for so-called ‘wrongs’ done to British traders, waiving compensation for similar wrongs done to Spain. But when she offered payment, the English dogs slapped Spain‘s hand aside, saying it was not enough! This insult will not go unavenged. The King has ordered you to secure our trade routes and has issued letters of marque for the harrying of British merchantmen – let their own methods be used against them! In the fulness of time, our brother France has promised his support.

Control the seas and you control the fate of the New World. Whichever side you choose, glory and honour – and prizes galore – are yours for the taking. Provided you avoid court martial and disgrace.

Yellow Jack is a naval war game for two players, set during the years 1739-1743. It explores the roles of the navies of Britain, Spain, and France in the Caribbean. Scale is “operational” – that is, the playing pieces represent squadrons of as many as four ships, rather than individual men-o-war. Other counters represent leaders (good and bad), “light” forces such as frigates and galleys, and “formations” that allow you to concentrate your forces.

Tactical themes are eschewed in favour of operational issues: keeping your forces in fighting trim, being at the right place at the right time, & dealing with a mounting list of instructions, orders, and unfilfillable mandates from your Government. Combat, though abstracted, takes into account leadership, the class and condition of your ships, and of course the Weather Gauge. In an Age of Sail, wind and water conditions are critical, even at the “operational” level. Movement uses a point-to-point system where costs change with the wind and you will often be unable to go where you desire. Actions are “simultaneous”, but unlike many naval games, plotting is not required. Special features of Yellow Jack include the Hurricane Season, amphibious assaults and land campaigns, and the Yellow Jack itself – Yellow Fever.

Time Required: 3 hours for a Minor Scenario; 1 weekend for the Campaign Game. As a bonus, there are also scenarios for 1744-1748, when the Caribbean struggle became submerged in the greater War of the Austrian Succession; these allow an Extended Campaign covering 1739-1748.

Components:

6 die cut counter sheets – 720 counters – including the naval forces of Britain, Spain, and France, plus Pirates (no Caribbean naval game is complete without Pirates). One of the counter sheets includes all the important naval leaders who participated in the War of the Austrian Succession; another consists of land units – all the regiments that fought in the Caribbean. There is also a sheet of generic markers.

37 wooden disks representing “task forces” (boxed game only; regular counters are also supplied to represent these items).
48” x 54” map depicting the Caribbean, Gulf of Mexico, and Carolinas coastline.

1 series rulebook, 1 exclusive rule book, 2 scenario/OOB books, 1 set of charts & tables, historical commentary. 1 set of display cards.

156641.name: Fiat: Diceless Roleplaying Compact
156641.description:
from the website:

... I wasn't enthralled with some of the particulars of [the Amber Diceless] system (such as the fact that the outcome of all conflicts is clearly determined even before they begin).

To get around this aspect of pre-determined outcome a system of token spending has been implimented in Fiat. Token systems are nothing groundbreaking in RPGs. Similar things have been used before to help skew the odds of a given outcome in games using dice. But in Fiat spending tokens doesn't simply provide a greater chance of success at a given action, it causes events in general to unfold in a more unlikely (and hopefully more impressive or interesting) way that the player intends.

So while the outcome of a conflict is no longer pre-determined neither is it left to chance. Whatever happens at least one of the conflict participants will end up having the narrative unfold as they prefer.

156642.name: DRAT System
156642.description:
from What it is About:

One of the primary goals of the DRAT System is to create a role-playing system that facilitates systems and settings that do not translate well to traditional role-playing systems. That is to say, settings like Star Trek have elements which are inconsistent. Traditional RPGs often functions best in consistent set of setting presumptions. If a players fires his phaser at a ship and it is powerful enough to destroy it then he will reasonably expect it to happen every time he fires at a ship. However, in many stories there are exceptions that move the story forward.

To resolve this we need to look to cooperative role-playing systems. In this manner, a group of like minded people can use such a system to explore settings that do not follow a predictable set of rules. Plot exceptions can be agreed upon by the Group and not become a point of disruption in a game but rather an event to drive the story forward.

from DRAT System:
DRAT System stands for Dice-less Role-playing And Tactics System. The goal of this system is to provide the tools for a cooperative storytelling experience. If everyone in the group is not committed to telling a story, the game will not work. To that end, make sure that all members of the group are aware and willing to participate in telling the story as well as describing their character’s action.

156643.name: GURPS Harry Potter
156643.description:
from the Introduction:
Several months ago, I finally broke down and read one of the Harry Potter books. Like everyone else, I became addicted. I quickly read all four books in the series in quick succession and then re-read them. As I read, I kept wondering if J.K. Rowling was a former gamer, because the parameters of her world were so carefully thought out. Underneath the prep school fantasy, there was a tautly constructed world with its own internal logic that begged to be further fleshed out.

This variant requires GURPS Basic at the very least. A full-fledged GURPS Harry Potter campaign requires GURPS Compendium I, Grimoire and Magic as well. GURPS Bestiary, Fantasy Bestiary, Fantasy Folk and Undead are handy, but not essential.

156644.name: Historical Folks
156644.description:
from the Introduction:
GURPS Historical Folks follows in the spirit of Rogues,Warriors and Wizards, but instead of providing templates for ultra-competent adventurers, this book covers members of everyday professions at Tech Levels 0- 3. By keeping the point totals low, these templates may be used “as-is” for characters in low-powered games or by GMs to create “average” members of the professions in a matter of seconds. Of course, players in higher-point-value campaigns can still use these templates as the basis for more powerful characters.

from Using This Book:
Historical Folks contains 116 templates, each with a description of the character type, a list of appropriate advantages, disadvantages and skills (along with an explanation of why these were chosen), and a few ideas on how to customize the template to different campaigns or settings. Each template is accompanied by a sample character that the GM can use as a “generic” member of the profession.

156645.name: Historical Folks: Conversion for use with GURPS Fourth Edition
156645.description:
from the Introduction:
Collecting templates from over a dozen authors, Historical Folks was originally slated to be an official GURPS supplement. After its compilation, Steve Jackson Games decided not to go forward with the book and the rights reverted back to Brian C. Smithson. Brian decided to make this supplement freely available to the gaming community and spent many hour s turning the rough draft into a professional quality sourcebook, which has been downloaded and used by countless GURPS players.

This book updates the templates from Historical Folks to make them compatible for use with GURPS Fourth Edition. It is not a standalone product, as none of the design notes, customization notes, or sample characters have been copied over. Rather, think of this as an appendix to the original, updating it to the newest edition of GURPS.

156646.description:
These character meeples can be used to replace the plain family member discs that are included with Caverna.

The character meeples come in seven colors — red, green, blue, purple, brown, yellow, and teal. Each color contains three separate designs:
- Adult male
- Adult female
- Child (either male or female, depending on color)

The exact family composition can be completely customized.
156646.name: Caverna: Character Meeples

156647.name: Symposium
156647.description:
website blurb:
The Symposium was written by Talislanta luminary Colin “Psychedelic Goblin” Chapman. This Talislanta Companion was scheduled to be released by Shooting Iron Design for 4e Talislanta. Unfortunately, Shooting Iron Design and Talislanta parted ways before it could see print. This 66-page guide is packed with excellent information on creative spell casting, new archetypes, cultures, customs, equipment, and skills. In addition, there is a chapter on windships and their details,and an optional Benefits/Hindrances system for character creation.

156648.description:
Blood of the Werewolf is a different type of Werewolf game as at the start of play, you don't know your own identity but others do. Thus, you need to observe the actions of others to figure out who you are. Another difference from traditional Werewolf games is that it requires no moderator and if your character dies, you can still participate in the discussion — and possibly even win!

In the game, players are divided into two camps: Manlike and Werewolf. During the game, players accuse one another through confidential markers, which send others to death through family trial. When the number of surviving players drops to a predetermined threshold, which is based on the number of players, the camp with more survivors wins.
156648.name: Blood of the Werewolf

156649.name: Gettysburg Campaign: Post Card Game
156649.description:
Distributed for advertising Command Magazine Japan #113 (Battle of Gettysburg).

Another post card game from Command Magazine. And downloadable from their site.

The map covers from Fredericksburg to Harrisburg.
Using only ten units. And ends in only 9 turns.
Each player plots which of his corps activated. Then, roll for initiative. There's no fixed combat phase. Combat suddenly occurs when both players roll the same number and ends the turn after resolving the combats.

So, it is very tricky game but needs strategic planning.

156652.description: With these downloadable cards anyone can delve into making their own scenarios - for themselves and their party. Create the story, split it into chapters and prepare events that will give your game the flavor you want.
156652.name: Machina Arcana: Fabula Rasa

156653.description:
This downloadable add-on (Kickstarter Add-on) is for those of you who like to completely organize your explorer's playing area or simply wish to reduce the number of tokens, by using a numberized scale to slide upon, using just one token. Every format comes in 4 different types - one for each explorer type!

The formats are:
- 14 x 16 cm / 5.5 x 6.2 inch
- 45 x 25 cm / 17.7 x 9.8 inch

It is used as a simplified way of keeping track of health, essence, stamina and equipment
156653.name: Machina Arcana: Player Boards

156656.name: Hockey
156656.description:
'Hockey' is an ice hockey simulation game played with a standard deck of 52 cards.

Players attempt to match the card played by their opponent to create a "breakaway" (also known as "clearing the ice") and then also matching the opponent's following play to score a "goal."

Each play through the deck is considered a "period." Five cards are dealt to each player at a time, except the last deal of the period when all remaining cards are dealt. Three periods constitute a complete game. The deal switches after each period.

Players take turns playing one card from their hand face up in a common playing area. All cards are played on top of one another so that only the most recently played card is visible.

If a played card matches the rank (number) of the top card of the pile (e.g. a "6" is played on top of another "6") it creates a "breakaway" for that player. Jacks always create breakaways when played, regardless of the previous card in the stack.

Once a breakaway has been created, that player now needs to try to match the rank of the next card played by the opponent. If able to do so, a goal is scored.

The player with the most goals at the end of the game is the winner.

156657.name: Lilith
156657.description:
publisher blurb

“Satan here held his Babylonish court, and in the blood of stainless childhood the leprous limbs of phosphorescent Lilith were laved.” Lilith as Queen of the Vampires, Lady of the Night — or as First Rebel and First Heroine? We look at the many faces of Lilith, as a Trail of Cthulhu titan (Elder Goddess or Great Old One), Night’s Black Agents vampire queen, Mutant City Blues super-Typhoid Mary, and at her role in the center of the First Esoterror Operation.

156658.description:
Stormy Weather is two player game about two mad scientists competing to win a gardening trophy, using a series of increasingly powerful weather machines. Play takes place on a 3x5 board, where each square has one of five types of weather. Players take on the identity (and abilities) of one of the mad scientists.

Players use their weather machines to move or create weather, with the aim of getting good weather to their side of the board or giving bad weather to their opponents. These can range from the humble remote control cloud to the gargantuan Noahmatic or the planetary realigner. Each machine can normally be used once per round, so the sequencing of play is important. At the end of each turn, sun and rain help gardens to grow, while heatwave and lightning cause them to wither and die.

The final action of the game comes from the play of a 'taunt' card, which contains a special, hidden move and an associated threat to yell at your opponent.

The player with the most flowers at the end of the game will be the winner.
156658.name: Stormy Weather

156659.description:
Timeline: 60 ans de télévision à la RTBF is a card game played using 110 cards. Each card depicts an event in the history of the Belgian television, with the year in which that event occurred on only one side. Players take turns placing a card from their hand in a row on the table. After placing the card, the player reveals the date on it. If the card was placed correctly with the date in chronological order with all other cards on the table, the card stays in place; otherwise the card is removed from play and the player takes another card from the deck.

The first player to get rid of all his cards by placing them correctly wins. If multiple players go out in the same round, then everyone else is eliminated from play and each of those players are dealt one more card for another round of play. If only one player has no cards after a bonus round, he wins; otherwise play continues until a single player goes out.

Timeline: 60 ans de télévision à la RTBF can be combined with any other title in the Timeline series.
156659.name: Timeline: 60 ans de télévision à la RTBF

156660.name: Chalice of Pericles
156660.description:
from the PDF

Your quest for the Chalice of Pericles has led to a storm battered cottage in the shadows of a mountain crested by an ancient temple’s ruins. But your journey has been in vain. The old scholar, Isaac, whose guidance you seek, is not to be found. A half eaten meal suggests a hasty departure, upturned furniture hints at foul play. Cold, wet and exhausted, you settle into restless sleep...

...She comes to you in a dream, a vision of beauty and nobility from a bygone era. Her lips are still but her desperate plea is clear “Seek the Chalice of Pericles. It must not fall into the hands of Darkan Hess”.

156661.description:
Italia, as a Campaign game, can last from July 1943 until May 1945.

The game has three game rule level components – Fundamental, Basic, and Advanced with additional optional rules for Basic and Advanced levels.
There are several scenarios starting with operation "Husky," the invasion of Sicily. Other scenarios are: "Avalanche," the invasion of the Italian mainland; Diadem, the battle for Monte Cassino; and the Gothic Line battles in northern Italy. Some scenarios have alternate ending dates depending upon the level of reaction forces of the Axis and the level of force commitment of the Allies. Players can be from 2 – 4. "Husky" works well with 3 players and "Diadem" works well with 4 players. Game victory is determined by obtaining geographic goals by certain dates (see the Advance Game Time Record).

Game by Tom Oleson with Bruno Sinigaglio and map and graphics by Mark Simonitch.
156661.name: Italia

156662.description:
Bolster your armies with Immortal Tales, the third expansion for Hordes: High Command!

Immortal Tales contains 5 copies each of 16 different cards, plus 4 additional warlock cards, to bring new strategies to your Trollblood, Circle Orboros, Skorne, and Legion of Everblight decks.

Requires Hordes: High Command core set to play.
156662.name: Hordes: High Command – Immortal Tales

156663.name: Shadowland Online
156663.description:
From the developer:
A free massively multiplayer game where you can farm, build, role-play and quest. Search for the lost St. Eloi gem. This mysterious gem was shattered by the fairies to hide from the evil Ossanal who has invaded the world. You must recruit legendary heroes like King Leonidas, Genghis Kahn and King Arthur who will help you save this lost world.

-Enter a twisted fantasy where Ossanal and his undead forces rule
-Space-time travel to different ages
-Recruit legendary heroes like King Leonidas, Genghis Kahn and King Arthur
-Join an alliance to march towards victory

Source: The Developer Website.

156664.name: Crystal Saga
156664.description:
From the developer:

Crystal Saga is a free massively multiplayer game set in the world of Vidalia, where life is as beautiful as it is dangerous. Train your monster or challenge friends. Customize your character and upgrade your skills for battle.

- Customizable characters
- PvP action and a complete RPG experience
- Hunt for treasure and other valuable items
- Slay dangerous beasts
- Train your monster to fight with you

Source: The Developer Website.

156665.name: Galaxy Online 2
156665.description:
From the developer:

Play Galaxy Online II and become a cosmic legend today. All the greatest leaders, tacticians, and engineers from across the universe can be found in Galaxy Online II. Each brings their unique talents to serve your ever growing empire. Build a mighty utopia or dominate other planets with a vicious fleet of starships. Choose your role wisely as you enter the vast realms of space!

- Recruit a wide variety of commanders with their own special abilities!
- Design your own fleet of personal warships!
- Face off against increasingly difficult bands of pirates!
- Conquer your enemies and plunder their resources!
- Scramble your ships for deep-space dogfights in the GOII League!

Source: The Developer Website.

156666.name: Galaxy Online
156666.description:
User Summary
Galaxy Online is a space-themed MMO RTS game. Players build a home base and assemble a fleet of ships, then wage war. The game is free to play with optional upgrades available for purchase.

156667.name: DDTank 2
156667.description:
From the developer:

DDTank 2 is a free casual turn-based action shooter filled with intense PvP battles. With plenty of game play variety, you can fight with unique weapons such as rocket launchers and ninja stars, customize your gear, adopt pets, farm and participate in world boss events. In DDTank 2, there’s always something to blow up!

- Turn-based action shooter with intense PvP action
- Gameplay variety with battles, farming and quests
- Customize your weapons and gear
- Adopt and customize pets

Source: The Developer Website.

156668.description:
Card Hockey League is an ice hockey simulation game played with a standard deck of 52 cards.

The two players take on the roles of team managers. The game is played over 3 rounds (periods). The players should ideally play facing each other and have access to a 6-card inverted pyramid game area.

Each game area consists of 3 rows. The row closest to the player represents the goalkeeper. A single card is placed in this row. The second row holds two cards, representing defenders. The third, and final row, holds three cards, representing the forwards on the team. All cards are placed face up in a portrait orientation except the goalkeeper which is placed face down in a landscape orientation.

The first player, determined in whatever fashion the players desire, shuffles the deck and secretly looks at the top card. He can choose to place this card in any open position in his own play area. Once placed, the card cannot be moved. Once all six spots are filled, the deck is passed to the opponent who fills his own six spots in like manner.

Players take turns advancing on their opponent. Each turn begins with the player flipping over the top card of the deck and comparing it to his opponent's line of forwards. If the card matches or beats another card in value, both cards are discarded and the player is considered having advanced past that hockey player. If multiple cards meet the criteria, the player chooses which route to take.

There is a strategic element when deciding which route to take when advancing on your opponent. With your first card, you compare against the three forwards. Once you have overcome a forward, your options for advancement may be limited. At no point are you allowed to skip another card in order to reach a more favorable card.

Let's say that you use your first card to overtake the center forward with your first card — you now have clear line of sight to both remaining forwards and the two defenders, but the goal is still blocked. If, on the other hand, you advanced past the left side forward, only the center forward and left defender are "open" to you.

Once the goal is "open", you are free to attempt to score at any point. You simply announce that you will shoot instead of taking on a hockey player. Your card is compared to the value of the goalkeeper. If your card is higher in value, you have scored a goal. Regardless, both cards are discarded as usual.

Whether a goal is successfully scored or not, it is now your opponents turn. Play also switches if you fail to successfully overtake enough players to clear an open path to your opponent's goal.

Your opponent will begin his turn by first filling any open spots as was done when the game began. He then takes his turn as normal.

Special Rule: When only one card is left in the deck, a player may, on his turn, assuming his team slots are filled, attempt a shot on goal regardless of whether an open path exists or not.

Once the deck is exhausted, the period is considered having ended. All cards are gathered up, play switches to the next player who shuffles and drafts his team as was done at the beginning of the game.

Once three periods have been played, the player with the most goals is declared the winner. There are no rules for breaking ties.
156668.name: Card Hockey League

156669.name: DDTank
156669.description:
User Summary

DDTank is a cutesy Chinese action/shooter MMO with RPG elements. The main gameplay involves players attempting to blow each other up using a variety of weaponry. The game is free-to-play with optional upgrades available to purchase.

156670.name: Are you joking?
156670.description:
"Are you joking?" is an educational game for English learners. It consists of two type of cards. One type has tongue twisters, jokes, quotes and such; the other type contains words (in English and German). One player reads one card of the first type, then counts from 10 to 0. The other players check whether they hold word cards with words that are included in the text. If so, they can discard them in front of themselves and draw new cards. Players who manage not to laugh during the countdown get an extra card; if everyone laughs, the reader gets it.
After a certain number of rounds, the player with most points on his/her cards is the winner.
There are some advanced rules included, for example demanding a certain reading style.

156671.name: 3D&T Alpha Instant Play: Manual do Jugador
156671.description:
from the manual:
Este guia não inclui orientações para mestres, vantagens únicas, e grande parte das vantagens, desvantagens e regras de combate avançadas. O motivo é simples: seu objetivo é salvar mestres experientes em situações desastrosas (como quando, por exemplo, em uma nova mesa muitos jogadores iniciantes enrolam com o grande livro de regras por horas, ou mesmo quando aquele seu “amigo”, sem avisar, aparece para fazer uma visita e resolve entrar na mesa de RPG e você precisa que ele faça sua ficha rápido, e sem fazer muitas perguntas) e ajudar a introduzir jogadores iniciantes nos conceitos de 3D&T.

[english translation]
This guide does not include guidelines for game masters, unique benefits, a large part of the advantages, disadvantages or advanced combat rules. The reason is simple: the goal is to save experienced game masters in disastrous situations (such as when, for example, in a new game many beginning players curl up with the main rule book for hours, or her "friend", visits unannounced and decides to play and you need to set them up quickly, without too many questions) and help to introduce players beginners in the concepts of 3D&T.

156672.name: Wings of Destiny
156672.description:
From the developer:

Rebuild your Wings to Save the World. In Wings of Destiny, enter a world where once kindred spirits, the Angels and Demons are splintered into opposing factions. The Angels turned to the powerful "Wings of Destiny" to battle the evil demons. But the Wings were shattered, and now you must rebuild them to save the world from darkness.
- A complete overview of all quests, dungeons, events, tournaments, and other activities to enjoy daily!
- Take a dip in the Hot Springs, escort treasures across the world, and more! The action never stops!
- Join Guilds, make friends, build a Base, attack rivals, raid territories, earn wages, and so much more!
- Enhance your gear, refine attributes, and inlay Gems for more power! Your weapon will literally glow with power!
- With frequent Costume updates, there’s no limit to how you can dress for success! Look stylish no matter the occasion!
- Challenge other players to win Coins and even a statue in your honor!

Source: The Developer Website.

156673.name: The Fugitive (Issue 4 - 1987)
rpg: Judge Dredd the Role-Playing Game (Games Workshop)
156673.description:
Issue 4 of the British magazine; The Fugitive.

Contents


Editorial/Contents
Battle of the Halji '5' Competition
Asthni Interview
Wot? No Dice?
An Introduction to Play By Mail
Megalomania
Debate Box
To Hell and Back - Live Role Playing in The Labyrinthe
Rumours
Stand and Deliver
You Review
Final Words
Ozymandias
Response
News
Club Profile - Haverhill Gamers Guild

156674.description:
The Danger Card deck helps the players to shape the difficulty level of the game to their tastes. Any mission can be customized by simply replacing the standard Close-Encounter cards with the Danger variants making the game more challenging.

In Galaxy Defenders, one Close Encounter card is drawn on each Alien turn. With the standard Close Encounter cards, if there are no matching aliens on the battlefield, the alien turn typically ends immediately.

However, with the Close Encounter Danger Variant Cards, if there are no matching aliens on the map [as indicated by the Effects section of the card], new aliens are teleported onto the map.
156674.name: Galaxy Defenders: Close Encounter Danger Variant Cards

156675.name: The Misty Isles
156675.description:
From the introduction:

"'The Misty Isles' describes persons and events on an island chain. While not particularly rich in material items, it provides adventure and inter-related intrigue for fantasy gamers.

Main items or people/events are listed for each hex. The referee should decide in advance where in the hex the action will take place and can fill in related experience for the rest of the hex."


=

"The Misty Isles" was the third "Dungeon Master Kit" published by Wee Warriors (after "Palace of the Vampire Queen" and "The Dwarven Glory", which are both set within the Misty Islands). It was their first module published without the support of TSR.

156676.name: Cards of Candor
156676.description:
An adult card game that will have you laughing all night. You will be amazed about what you will find out about your friends.

It's a simple and fun adult card game that is different every time you play, as different groups will respond in different ways. You will find out more about your friends or new people at a party. You will be amazed and surprised about the answers you get to intimate, probing questions. We are sure you will be surprised about what you learn about your friends.

In its simplistic form, a dealer reads a question from the deck and you anonymously answer 'Yes' or 'No'. The dealer tries to guess how many answered 'Yes' or 'No', and if they guess correctly, they keep the question card. If not the dealer decides which stories they want to hear why people answered 'Yes' or 'No'. If the dealer wants to hear the 'Yes' stories and you as a player answered yes, you can choose to tell the story to win the card, or keep quiet and remain anonymous. If there are more than one 'Yes' cards, then multiple people can tell their stories and the dealer decides which story wins. At the end of the game, the player who has gathered the most cards wins the game.

The great thing about this game is that you have the freedom to choose to remain anonymous or to share the stories behind your answer - so you decide on what to divulge to the group you’re playing with, it allows you to freely express something in public without the repercussions.

The game provides the environment to share stories and situations and engage in conversations that you would not normally engage in. You will be amazed what you find out about your friends. Is an adult game(18+), so as you can imagine there are some pretty risque questions.

Here are a couple of 'tame' sample questions in the deck:

Have you ever had a DUI?
Have you ever been arrested?
Have you ever lied on a tax return?

156679.description: Innovative card holder with a tilt function. It consists of two compartments. Each compartment is equipped with a roof-like bulge, so that the deck of cards can be accessed from both sides comfortably. The sturdy card holder can be connected to a larger display. A set consists of 6 card holders (each with 2 compartments) and has space for the base game as well as both expansions.
156679.name: Die Fürsten von Catan: 6 Kartenhalter

156680.name: Frederick the Great: A Dangerous Time
156680.description:
This is a sequel game of Nobunaga: A Dangerous Time from the same designer, Tetsuya Nakamura.

The game covers the whole period of seven years war in Europe.
One turn is 2 months. Map is a point to point type from Nancy to Konigsburg.

200 counters, 32 cards for 2 players.

156681.name: Buntes Allerlei
156681.description:
"Buntes Allerlei" - translated it means something like "colourful sundries" or "colourful assortment" is a learning game by Clementino in their "Sapientino - the small bright guy" series. It consists of a bag, a sand timer, a colour die and 4 cards with seven different figures/shapes, which also differ between the player cards. The shapes fit into holes in the cards and have different shapes and colours, e.g. the helicopter, the woman, the man, the moon...
Its a collection of games die rolling, grabbing the shape blind from the bag etc.

The objective of the game is to be the first player having a completed board - by having rolled all colours and thus having gotten all missing objects containing these colours, or by grabbing the right items blind from the bag.

156682.name: Pinky Piggys Quartett
156682.description:
Despite the name, this is not a standard Quartett game. There are 40 cards in 9 sets of four plus 4 Jokers. It is a simple children's game. Each player has a hand of 4 cards and must draw one from the undealt stack. If a set of four is acquired, it is laid down in front of the player. A Joker can be any card. If a Joker is in a displayed set, a player drawing the actual card may substitute it and add the taken Joker to his or her hand. When all the sets are collected, the one with the most wins.

It is made by the famous chocolate maker, Ferrero.

156683.name: Dungeon of Emera
156683.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dungeon of Emera is a printable dungeon floorplan compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone gameboard, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Dungeon of Emera is a geomorphic set, comprising 4 10x10 square battlemaps which can be arranged in multiple layouts. Each tile features corridors and rooms in a dungeon setting, with features such as a pit, a flooded chamber, a giant bronze skull, and more. The geomporhic nature means that there are countless ways to arrange them.

Also included is a set of 300dpi full size jpgs, for poster printing or VTT.

156684.name: Creatures of Light 1: The Most High and Major Powers
156684.description:
From publisher blurb:

Since they arrived on Earth and delivered the judgment of the Most High against humanity, the Forces of Light have dominated the world.

They’ve built Realms of Light on every populated continent, from which they issue edicts to humanity and send forth parties to seek out and destroy the Darkness. They also monitor the activities of the new supernatural beings of the world, especially the neomages they’re sworn to protect, and the new race of the seraph-touched that has recently come to their attention.

The principal motivations of the Light are the battle against the Darkness and carrying out the will of the Most High; the protection the Light provides humanity seems almost incidental.

The Light represents the most powerful unified force on Earth, but its actions are driven by unrevealed designs, and the forces of Light can be as dangerous to humanity as the Dark forces they oppose.

This PDF details the forces opposed to the Darkness.

156685.name: Windows Mouse
156685.description:
User Summary

The standard Windows mouse is the controller for by far the most of the Windows games.

156686.name: Oak Grove Whispers
156686.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ages ago, a religious order known as the Druun practiced rituals from inside sacred oak groves, ceremonial pools, and stone henges. In time, the Church of Law and Order suppressed the Druunic teachings, and the ancient holy sites were lost, forgotten, or converted to other uses.

One such former site is located in the capital city of Dolmvay in the center of a small neighborhood known as Whiteoak Square. This neighborhood has recently been experiencing a strange phenomenon: At night, small dancing lights have been seen floating throughout the neighborhood. The residents were afraid of this sorcery at first, however, the lights seem to exude a feeling of peace and contentment, and the locals have grown used to them.

How it Started

A few weeks ago, a butcher named Walton Brand was clearing out his cellar when he stumbled upon a secret underground passage that led to an ancient Druun hall. This hall was filled with lost relics, arcane lore, and forgotten treasures of the Druun.

Walton told his friends, Loomis the Baker and the chandler Stefan of Walsbury, and the three men began sneaking away from their wives at night to dress in Druun finery and pretend to be men of wealth. A harlot named Red Kirsten was hired to attend them as they drank, feasted, and cavorted in the sacred hall.

Unbeknownst to the revelers, the Druun hall still retained some of its magical powers and their merriment awakened the ancient guardian spirits of the grove. These creatures, known as faerlings, are the lights that have been seen dancing throughout the neighborhood. The faerlings were given life by the revelers' glee, and they project that joy and happiness onto the other residents of the neighborhood. This glee, however, is about to turn to horror. . .

Oak Grove Whispers is a Labyrinth Lord adventure designed for 3-6 characters of 1st-3rd levels (about 10 levels total). The adventure is broken up into three chapters that take place in a small neighborhood located in the capital city of Dolmvay (the Labyrinth Lord is free to substitute any medium- to large-sized city from his own campaign world).

Oak Grove Whispers involves a mixture of roleplaying, investigation, and dungeon crawling, so a diverse range of classes is recommended. As the adventure is set in a civilized city, the characters must also be careful their interaction with NPCs does not land them on the wrong side of the law.

156687.name: The One Who Watches From Below
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
156687.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Level 1 Adventure

The rumors are true! The secret cave of the mystics holds a hoard of treasure vast enough to buy the kingdom seven times over. Gold coins piled as high as snow banks! Gleaming swords and jewel-encrusted wands crackling with arcane energy! Precious gems as large as your fist! The only thing standing between your present circumstances and a life of fabulous wealth is a pesky, slumbering elder god with a penchant for consuming entire worlds, an endless army of vat-grown hybrid monstrosities, a veritable tidal wave of disembodied eyes with awesome powers, giant acid worms, and a curse with the power to rip the still-living eyes from your skull. Do you have the mettle to stare down a god or will your eyes forever adorn the vault of The One Who Watches From Below?

The winner of the Mystery Map Adventure Design Competition! In June 2012, Goodman Games sponsored a special adventure design competition. Our Free RPG Day 2012 adventure module included an incomplete adventure map. Readers could complete the map, send in their associated ­adventure proposal, and compete for a $1,000 contract to write that adventure. A panel of distinguished judges read the flood of proposals, and finally whittled the field down to a handful of contenders. After lengthy debate, a winner was chosen.

This adventure is the winner of the Mystery Map Adventure Design Competition. There were many great submissions to the competition, but Jobe Bittman’s stood out above them all. This adventure has a strong Appendix N theme, unique encounters that your players will remember for a long time, many highly visual scenes that will stand out in your players’ minds, and some terrific twists and turns. It also features one of the most creative player handouts you have ever seen. Prepare for a very fun time. We think you’ll enjoy this adventure as much as we did.

156688.name: Classic Monsters Augmented
156688.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Mindblast! This is the first in a series of psionic supplements de- signed to help you run games using the rules from Psionics Unleashed by Dreamscarred Press.

This volume aims to give you monsters with a psionic flair that you can use in your everyday games. Everything you need to use these monsters is included here. These monsters are de- signed to serve as an excellent addition to your game, or as an introduction to psionics.

All of the monsters within should be familiar to any veteran of the game. They have been given a psionic twist, which lets them fit into any game that uses the psionics rules. Many of these creatures are more cerebral than their mundane versions, but they should still be run to their statistics. They have only the advantages listed, some are quite bright, but others are only somewhat more intelligent than the base species. Hope you enjoy!

Included within are the following:

Psionic barghest: These demonic goblin-kin have potent powers that make them stealthy predators, able to feed on a settlement for months undetected.
Buccaboos: Biggest and smartest of the goblinoids, these psionic cousins of bugbears use their powers of disguise and ambush in their pursuit of brutal murder.
Psionic cats: These gifted felines are surprisingly vicious predators, floating at eye level as they stalk their victims with eerie stealth.
Crystal eaters: These cousins to rust monsters have powerful mandibles that quickly chew through stone and gems.
Deutettin: Sharing the future sight of the Cyclopes and the dual minds of the ettin, these psionic giants are sure to make a lasting impact in the memories of your PCs.
Golden-eyed owlbears: These captivating beasts are sure to lure many a PC to a savage end in their desire to rid the world of non-magical creatures.
Mindspiders: Cousins to the deadly araneas, these malevolent spiders use their mental pow- ers to infiltrate humanoid settlements undetected.
Reds: These brutal hobgoblin cousins are even more capable of organizing entire goblinoid armies in their attempts to rule the world.




The creatures included within this volume are simply the tip of the iceberg as far psionic monsters are concerned. Hopefully these will inspire you to increase the psionic quotient in your games!

boardgameimplementation: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game
boardgameintegration: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game
Legendary: Big Trouble in Little China
Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game
Legendary: Big Trouble in Little China
156689.description:
The Legendary universe gets flipped upside down in Legendary: Villains – Marvel Deck Building Game, and you can now play as villains trying to take out the heroes protecting the city!

The goal of the game remains roughly the same as in the first Legendary game as players can work both with and against other players to overcome obstacles that the game throws at them. In this case, however, players use the super villains of the Marvel Universe — including Venom, Magneto and Loki — to battle superheroes such as the X-Men, the Avengers and Spider-Friends.

Legendary: Villains – Marvel Deck Building Game is a standalone game that includes all the cards needed to play.
156689.name: Legendary: Villains – A Marvel Deck Building Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 78-- Star Studded Origins 2014 Wrap Up

156690.name: Archmage Path Abilities
156690.description:
From publisher blurb:

The 14th in our new series of Mythic Minis, Archmage Path Abilities brings you 9 brand-new mythic path abilities for the Archmage path, from alchemical abilities like Alchemical Archmagery and Dirty Bombs to abilities suited for any arcane caster like Spell Dilation and Arcanist's Escape!

156691.name: The Book of Forbidden Magic
156691.description:
From publisher blurb:

Forbidden Spells of Incredible Power!

Everyone knows that there are some spells that are too dangerous, too wild, or just plain too powerful for any ambitious mage to cast. These rare, exotic, and above all forbidden spells are few and far between, but the immense opportunity that they provide to those who find a way to claim them is well worth the risks. And the risks are many: not only is there a risk that any practitioner who takes up such a spell will be hunted for dabbling in forbidden and “black” magic, but the spells themselves invite danger, and by casting them, the mage opens himself up for the possibility of losing control, and causing a terrible calamity.

Still, such forbidden magic is highly desirable to spellcasters of every sort, because despite all of that, or perhaps because of it, these spells contain more power than those of the average sorcerer or wizard. Destroy your enemies with powerful killing spells like power word massacre and damnation, or take up more defensive magic, like mirror of the witch, which surrounds the caster with nigh-impenetrable mirrors that protect her from all forms of attack. Alternatively, cast dance of demons, and laugh as your victims destroy themselves and each other by enacting a vrock’s dance of ruin. Strip virtually any target of spellcasting ability with demise of the warlock, or force your victims to kill themselves with proclamation of suicide.

The Book of Forbidden Magic includes 47 new spells with the forbidden descriptor. These spells are more powerful than traditional spells, but come with a drawback in the form of profane points, and the possibility that each time one is cast, they may cause a horrible calamity to befall the caster. The book also contains detailed rules governing profane points and calamities, including nearly 50 different specific types of potential calamities, from horrible magical backlash of various sorts to accidental planar rifts of all kinds and numerous sorts of mental intrusion by otherworldly entities. If you want spellcasting in your game to be more exciting, or are looking for more options for your character and enjoy taking risks and dabbling with powers man was not meant to know, look no further than The Book of Forbidden Magic.

156692.name: They're Only Kobolds
156692.description:
From publisher blurb:

It's All in a Day's Work...

They're Only Kobolds is a short introductory adventure that takes your new character from a classless, zero-level nobody to a full fledged adventurer! As simple hirelings and torch-bearers, the supposed "heroes" have gotten in over their heads and its up to your characters to save the day! How difficult can it really be? After all, they're only kobolds...

They're Only Kobolds features expands on the 0th level character rules presented in Small Niche Games Guidebook to the City of Dolmvay and can easily be used to kick off your Dolmvay adventures! This short 15-page adventure will start them on the path to thrilling heroics... if they can survive.

156693.name: World Wonders Supplemental Volume 5: Constructs & Items
156693.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a supplement for “World Wonders” by Ennead Games. This volume focuses on constructs & items – Devices and equipment that can be used to benefit the settlement and kingdom they are housed in.

Wonders you will find inside:

Minor
Alarms - Alert your citizens to various events
Road Cleaner - Clean up the streets - literally
Wall Reinforcement - Make your walls stronger

Major
Reflective Mirror - Communicate or blind your enemies
Semi-Automated Defences - Protect your city
Transport Tubes - Transport small items at great speed

Unique
The Veil - Considered by some to be the best possible to defend your city.

156694.name: Servants of Shadow: Five Necromancy Themed Races
156694.description:
From publisher blurb:

Necromancy is not a study for the weak at heart, mind or soul. It is a study for those who desire true mastery over life and death…

It is true power – the power to overcome death itself, to grant one’s self immortality and to raise armies of untiring, unflinching and unwavering soldiers who unquestioningly obey your every command…

It is the seductive whispers of shadows, the chilling breath of a wraith and the wet bloody kiss of a Mohrg…

I can teach you the secrets of necromancy. I can make you immortal. I can show you the paths to power. But it will cost you… For there is always a price to pay…

Servants of Shadow is the latest in our series of racial guidebooks. We bring you five new necromancy-themed character race options to fill that dark hole in your heart. Within are three new races, three templates, new archetypes and prestige classes, dozens of feats, traits and magic. With 67 pages of content, all hyperlinked to the d20pfsrd website. Everything you need to resurrect your campaign and necromantic character options!

156695.name: Side Treks 01: The Crossroads of Spyley
156695.description:
From publisher blurb:

SideTreks from Chubby Monster Games are locations designed to be dropped into an existing campaign provide GMs with an easy and painless way to add interesting locations and NPCs with minimal preparation.

Spyley provides a remote location that can serve as a perfect resting spot or a base of operations for your players. At ten pages, Spyley provides a busy GM with a quick read but a fleshed out location that can be used in minutes at your game table.

Included in this product are:

PNG and JPG versions of the map, easy to drop into your favorite VTT
Multiple Adventure Hooks to get your players into Spyley
Details on three locations in Spyley
Interesting NPCs to add flavor to your game

156696.name: Stitching Church
156696.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Stitching Church is a religious organization designed to interact with your player characters in your existing setting. The resource is system neutral. Inside you will find suggestions for how to place the group, and what people know about them. You get a crisp summary of facts about the group's beliefs and organization. This resource provides ways to increase or decrease the threat they pose, sample members of the organization, a list of adventure hooks, and more.

156697.name: Temple of Celestial Revolution
156697.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Temple of Celestial Revolution houses an order of Templar that overthrow stable governments. When their astrologers tell them a government has ruled long enough to build up a toxic layer of secrets, they use a wide variety of tactics to overthrow that government--then they withdraw. They read the stars, waiting until the time is right to slay all the dragons and wizards to cleanse the world of magic. The Templar worship the goddess of the moon, and that makes them dangerous lunatics.

This system-neutral resource has the framework for the Templar, sample NPCs, suggestions for varying difficulty, a waystation, and suggestions for working all this in to your current game.

156698.name: The Order of the Sacred Deep
156698.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Order of the Sacred Deep is a religious organization designed to interact with your player characters in your existing setting. The resource is system neutral. Inside you will find suggestions for how to place the group, and what people know about them. You get a crisp summary of facts about the group's beliefs and organization. This resource provides ways to increase or decrease the threat they pose, sample members of the organization, a list of adventure hooks, and more.

156699.name: The Brass Horseshoe
156699.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Brass Horseshoe is a militant order dedicated to the God of War. They focus on how logistics, planning, and support win wars. This system-neutral issue has inspiration for using the Order in your game. You get sample NPCs, adventure hooks, common knowledge about the order, and its organization. Inside there are suggestions for how to vary their toughness in your campaign. These are not typical clerics, and they don't worship a generic god. Even if you have a pantheon in place, there are suggestions for how to include the God of War in your game. Try it out!

156700.name: Silent Bite
156700.description:
From publisher blurb:

Silent Bite is an aristocratic order dedicated to the Goddess of the Hunt. In the fine tradition of Robin Hood and Zorro, they are aristocrats resisting an occupying force. However, their method is assassination--one shot, one kill. This system-neutral issue has inspiration for using these assassins in your game. You get sample NPCs, adventure hooks, common knowledge about the order , and its organization. Inside there are suggestions for how to vary their toughness in your campaign. These are not typical clerics, and they don't worship a generic god. Even if you have a pantheon in place, there are suggestions for how to include the Goddess of the Hunt in your game. Try it out!

156701.name: Cult of Summation
156701.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Cult of Summation is a strange religious group of librarians and prison guards. They worship Nihlos, Goddess of Death and Punishment. One of Nihlos' favorite things is summaries--that's why your life flashes before your eyes before you die. This cult will get your life summary out of you before you are executed for your crimes. This resource provides the framework for the cult, as well as some sample NPCs, a map of a prison library, and lots of suggestions for how to use them as adventure hooks in your game.

156702.name: Moleskin Maps Volume Four
156702.description:
From publisher blurb:

This forth volume of Moleskin Maps contains ten of my Moleskin Maps, scanned and cleaned up. The maps are in PDF format, with a page devoted to the entire map and a GM Prep Page to assist in setting up the encounter or dungeon. The GM Prep Page is an excellent tool to help GMs prepare their game sessions.

The product also contains a zip file also contains a high resolution image of each of the maps so you can drop them into Fantasy Grounds, MapTool, or Roll20 to facilitate easy online game play.

156703.name: Moleskin Maps Volume Five
156703.description:
From publisher blurb:

This fifth volume of Moleskin Maps contains twelve of my Moleskin Maps, scanned and cleaned up. The maps are in PDF format, with a page devoted to the entire map and a GM Prep Page to assist in setting up the encounter or dungeon. The GM Prep Page is an excellent tool to help GMs prepare their game sessions.

The product also contains a zip file also contains a high resolution image of each of the maps so you can drop them into Fantasy Grounds, MapTool, or Roll20 to facilitate easy online game play.

156704.name: Shane's Delve
156704.description:
From publisher blurb:

Shane's Delve: A Short Cavern Delve...with kobolds!

A short adventure designed for Shane Knysh after he introduced me to some fine RPG supplemental products. This adventure includes a map and eight pages of Old School style adventure. The adventure is presented in a system-less fashion using common themes and elements found in any fantasy game. It should be easy for any GM to work this into any campagin.

156708.name: Games in Libraries: Essays on Using Play to Connect and Instruct
rpgcategory: Non-Rankable Item (item will not show in the rankings)
156708.description:
From publisher blurb:

Librarians are beginning to see the importance of game based learning and incorporating games into library services to increase patron engagement and interaction. This book is written for librarians interested in using games to improve patron or student knowledge of library services and decrease patron anxiety of the library. This book provides practical suggestions and methods of incorporating games or game elements into library services focusing on outreach and instruction.

This essay collection discusses innovative uses of games in libraries and focuses on the game making process. The contributors of this book are all interested in games and how they can be used for game-based learning or other library purposes, such as outreach. A variety of game usage across different types of libraries is considered.

The purpose of this book is to bring together distinctive uses of games in libraries or educational institutions and share these ideas with others to inspire the making and use of games by other librarians and educators.

156709.name: Star Cruiser (1980)
156709.description:
User Summary

A very early Galaxian clone for the Apple ][ computer.

156710.name: Das große Shell Rennspiel
156710.description:
This is a car racing game, so the first player to finish a certain number of turns, wins the game. The players use one die (not included in the game). If a player lands on a space with a star, he has to follow the instructions, printed on the game board. 16 collectible coins are used as playing pieces and are stored in recesses in the game board.

The game board and the coins were published as a merchandising tool by Shell in the 1970s. There is no box!

156711.description:
The Players travel from a predetermined starting point to a predetermined destination city. The players get to choose their own route. When they get to city with a red number, the players get a game marker. Most of the rules are left open to agreement by the players before the start of the game. To win the game, the player either has to be the first to reach the Destination, or get the most game markers. Which goal is used has to be agreed upon before the game starts.

The game was published in the 1930s/1940s, so the game board shows the German borders of this time. The goal was to teach children the geography and borders of the 3rd Reich.
156711.name: Wer will verreisen?

156712.name: The Original D&D Setting
156712.description:
from On OD&D's Setting:
